documents.document: @mellopuffy One of my locals used to do them. Sadly, they're long gone... =(

Fairfax printed a piece written by the PM on Stuff, a news website. That's not news, it's pure spin, and they know it.
Mr Trump's green light to anti-gay discrimination is very bad. If he is impeached, much, much worse will follow at the hands of Mr Pence.
@ShakingStick It is an excuse for a two year old, not a grown man.

@hcirePT I agree with you about the change in tone, and I think it's more than slight. I do wonder whether it will be temporary.
Nearly one-third of the refugees in Australia's offshore camps have been in detention for more than two years.

I learned French at school. I've rarely used it. But learning a second language taught me an extraordinary amount about English.
Many on social media who don't want children to speak Te Reo seem to have great difficulty even speaking English.

@kaupapa @reckonsemoji I don't think it was at a General Election. I'll do a little research. It would have been an Auckland seat, yes?
I don't care about Mr Trump's appearance and I don't care whether or not he is scared of stairs. I care a lot about his horrible policies.
@edmuzik A fantastic score. I really like how CM Sydenham has a low price, high turnover sales strategy.

@edmuzik I love it so much! Where from?
@transparency_a1 The country already has a (bipartisan) refugee policy even worse than his.
Now that I've had a chance to listen to Mr English's comments, I agree that his criticism of Mr Trump's ban was both indirect and weak.
It looks as though Sean Spicer's retweeting of @TheOnion actually happened, and is not just 'fake news'.
Quebec City police have announced that they consider the atrocity there to be a terrorist attack.
Did Sean Spicer really retweet @TheOnion? It just seems to good to be true.
I reject any politics in which human beings stop being regarded as individuals and are viewed only as a member of a category.
@CearaProut I am sending all my best wishes and my kindest and warmest thoughts to you. I'm sorry that I can't do more.
Delete Uber? My Uber is the bus. And sometimes I can't even afford that.
No. 1 problem with impeaching Mr Trump: Mr Pence. No. 2 problem: the politics of which Mr Trump is only one representative.
@grantrobertson1 It stands for Hero Of the Masses Of course.
I have witnessed three motor vehicle accidents today. All relatively minor, luckily.
Mr Trump's decision to simply ignore the court ruling on his immigration ban is exceptionally disturbing.
@Tat_Loo I've already ignored three calls to the dinner table, so I'll be off Twitter for an hour or so, but thanks for the discussion. =)
@Tat_Loo who are calling this measure a cop-out (and far worse). (2/2)
@Tat_Loo That's a valid point, but now he is also required to govern. And on right-wing social media, there are more than a few (1/2)
@JesDKArt @SGardinier It's certainly become common to forget, for eg, that an impeachment of Trump would result in a President Pence.
@notchyo1 @serenity22 @JoshuaGreen It's the logical extension of what every 'America Firster' is referring to.
@Tat_Loo and not his left one. The more demagogic the campaign rhetoric, the wider the gap between the hustings and actually governing.
@Tat_Loo We have different views on that point. I think Trump, because of the nature of his campaign, is vulnerable on his right flank (1/2)
@Tat_Loo That was my question. Do you think some of his 'base' will realise the contradiction? (2/2).
@Tat_Loo Now that he has specifically excluded from his ban the nationality of nearly all 9/11 attackers, will they still be fooled? (1/2)
Mr Trump's ban targeting many, but not all, Muslim nations, shows that this a measure against Muslim refugees specifically.
@Tat_Loo Why won't you just answer the question? Why these diversions? Do you think Mr Trump's fans will accept his "safety" argument?
@Tat_Loo It doesn't change my question - are Mr Trump's supporters stupid enough to swallow this oh-so-obvious lie? I fear they are. =(
@northshoreguynz Sadly, you're almost certainly right.
@Tat_Loo In my view, because Obama did it too is an extremely poor defense of anything. I'm not one of his fans.
Are Trump's supporters stupid enough to swallow an anti-terrorist "safety" ban on immigration that excludes Saudi Arabia?
"It's not a Muslim ban" says Mr Trump, insisting that his ban is honouring his pledge to ban Muslim immigration.
So few people seem to be aware that there is already a barrier along huge sections of the US - Mexico border.
@CherylBernstein Ah, my alma mater! The 13yo is not a seeker of higher things, then? ;-)

@melulater It's the same dynamic, to be sure, but I think Trump is so much more dangerous and hateful than Reagan. =(

We need to stop thinking of US intelligence agencies as 'on our side' against Trump. They remain our deadly enemies.
If Mr Trump's claims of massive electoral fraud were true, the election he won would be completely invalid, and a new election inevitable.
Today we learnt that there are alternative studies and alternative evidence of massive US electoral fraud. Alternative fraud, of course.

@reckonsemoji I'm not sure what is more bizarre - Mr Spencer thinking he is Nelson Mandela, or Mr Spencer thinking he is Carl Jung.
@DoctorJeph @Dovil @bootstheory You can still make it. I'll laugh, I promise.
@PMcDFace And if it was true, it would completely invalidate the election he won, requiring him to immediately call another.
